Package tekno

Class Relations

java.lang.Object
tekno.Relations
public class Relations
extends java.lang.Object
This class stores a representation of the graph in Java. By adding an SRO triple, it builds a graph abstraction, by memorizing the nodes and the edges (without duplicates). In this class are also implemented methods to discover aliases (not already discovered by coreference resolution) based on the termâ€™s Wikipedia Page ID: if two different terms have the same page ID they are aliases.

  • Constructor Details

    • Relations

  • Method Details

    • addRelation

      public void addRelation​(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String r, java.lang.String o)
      this is the main method of the class; First if the subject or the object of the triple are a pronoun contained in the attribute removePronouns, it returns (this is done to avoid having connections in the graph that are referred to an unknown entity). Then if the node Map attribute is empty it automatically adds a node for the subject and object and an edge which connects them; the ids for the nodes are generated by hashing the name of the nodes (only positive integer). This ids, obtained with hashing, are needed in order to optimize the search for duplicates. If not empty, the method checks for aliases, already inserted in the nodes Map, by cycling through and confronting the current node with the nodes to be inserted (both for subject and object). If a match is found, the node is added, but a new edge (for the alias relationship) is inserted between the matched nodes. If the match is not found, it simply adds the nodes to the Map and at the end inserts an edge for the relationship specified in the input.
      Parameters:
      s - subject
      r - relation
      o - object

    • printEdges

      public void printEdges()
      this method prints all the edges currently inserted. It is only used for debugging purposes.

    • printNodes

      public void printNodes()
      this method prints all the nodes currently inserted. It is only used for debugging purposes.

    • edgeIterator

      public java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer[],​java.lang.String>> edgeIterator()
      Returns:
      the Iterator for the edges attribute Map.

    • nodeIterator

      public java.util.Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String>> nodeIterator()
      Returns:
      the Iterator for the edges attribute Map.
